thread.title: IPL Auction 2017: Virat Kohli’s Royal Challenger’s Bangalore tick all boxes, what about other teams?
thread.title_full: IPL Auction 2017: Virat Kohli’s Royal Challenger’s Bangalore tick all boxes, what about other teams?

author: FE Online
title: IPL Auction 2017: Virat Kohli’s Royal Challenger’s Bangalore tick all boxes, what about other teams?
text:
IPL Auction 2017: Virat Kohli’s Royal Challenger’s Bangalore tick all boxes, what about other teams? IPL Auction 2017: Virat Kohli’s Royal Challenger’s Bangalore tick all boxes, what about other teams? IPL Auction 2017: KKR was in the market primarily to find replacements for Andre Rusell and Morne Morkel and captain Gautam Gambhir would feel that he has done it successfully with the signings of Chris Woakes, Trent Boult and Nathan Coulter-Nile. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 21, 2017 1:32 PM IPL Auction 2017: Ben Stokes was signed by Rising Pune Supergiants for Rs. 14.5 Crores. (Source: Twitter) 
IPL Auction 2017: Ben Stokes emerged as the most expensive player in the 2017 IPL Player Auction as a total of 66 players from the final list of 352 were sold at the Ritz-Carlton Hotel in Bengaluru. Stokes was signed by Rising Pune Supergiants for Rs. 14.5 Crores which made their intentions clear about improving their last year’s performance where they managed to win just 5 of their 14 watches. Here we have a look at where all the teams stand after the 2017 IPL auction. 
Delhi Daredevils: 
Delhi’s biggest problem last year was the failure of their top order but the management hasn’t made too changes in that. However, considering De Kock is still quite young, JP Duminy was the only experienced batsman in DD’s middle-order. Drafting Angelo Mathews and Corey Anderson can solve this problem but it will interesting to see how Rahul Dravid selects his 4 overseas players. 
Existing Players: JP Duminy, Mohammed Shami, Quinton de Kock, Shahbaz Nadeem, Jayant Yadav, Amit Mishra, Shreyas Iyer, Zaheer Khan, Sam Billings, Sanju Samson, Chris Morris, Carlos Brathwaite, Karun Nair, Rishabh Pant, CV Milind, Syed Ahmed, Pratyush Singh. Players Bought: Angelo Mathews (2 Cr), Corey Anderson (1 Cr), Kagiso Rabada (5 Cr), Pat Cummins (4.50 Cr), Ankit Bawne (INR 10 Lakhs), Aditya Tare (25 Lakhs), Murugan Ashwin (1 Cr), Navdeep Saini (10 lakh), Shashank Singh (10 Lakh) 
Gujarat Lions: 
Gujarat Lions was one team that didn’t spend too much money with Jason Roy being their only ‘Crore’ signing. However, the England batsman will face tough competition for a place in the side from Aaron Finch and Dwayne Smith. Indian bowlers is a bit of concern for Suresh Raina-led team as there are two many India outcasts in that department. 
Existing Players: Suresh Raina, Ravindra Jadeja, James Faulkner, Brendon McCullum, Dwayne Bravo, Aaron Finch, Dwayne Smith, Dinesh Karthik, Dhawal Kulkarni, Praveen Kumar, Andrew Tye, Ishan Kishan, Pradeep Sangwan, Shivil Kaushik, Shadab Jakati, Jaydev Shah. Players Bought: Nathu Singh (50 Lakh), Basil Thampy (85 Lakh), Tejas Singh Baroka (10 Lakhs), Manpreet Gony (60 Lakhs), Jason Roy (1 Cr), Munaf Patel (30 Lakh), Chirag Suri (10 Lakh), Shelly Shaurya (10 Lakh), Shubham Agrawal (10 Lakh), Pratham Singh (10 Lakh), AkshDeep Nath (10 Lakh) 
You may also want to watch: 
Kings XI Punjab: 
After the 2017 IPL Player Auction Punjab remains to be the weakest side on paper. Their experienced Indian players Murali Vijay and Wriddhiman Saha are not part of India’s limited-overs sides. However, England captain Eoin Morgan was a bargain buy at Rs.2 Crore and will add a lot of value to the team. 
Existing Players: David Miller, Manan Vohra, Axar Patel, Glenn Maxwell, Gurkeerat Singh, Anureet Singh, Sandeep Sharma, Shardul Thakur, Shaun Marsh, Wriddhiman Saha, M Vijay, Nikhil Naik, Mohit Sharma, Marcus Stoinis, KC Cariappa, Armaan Jaffer, Pardeep Sahu, Swapnil Singh, Hashim Amla. Players Bought: Eoin Morgan (2 Cr), Rahul Tewatia (25 Lakhs), T Natarajan (3 Cr), Matt Henry (50 Lakhs), Varun Aaron (2.80 Cr), Martin Guptill (50 Lakh), Darren Sammy (30 Lakh), Rinku Singh (10 Lakh) 
Kolkata Knight Riders: 
KKR was in the market primarily to find replacements for Andre Rusell and Morne Morkel. Captain Gautam Gambhir would feel that he has done it successfully with the signings of Chris Woakes, Trent Boult and Nathan Coulter-Nile. 
Existing Players: Gautam Gambhir, Sunil Narine, Kuldeep Yadav, Manish Pandey, Suryakumar Yadav, Piyush Chawla, Robin Uthappa, Shakib Al Hasan, Chris Lynn, Umesh Yadav, Yusuf Pathan, Sheldon Jackson, Ankit Singh Rajput, Andre Russell Players Bought: Trent Boult (5 Cr), Chris Woakes (4.20 Cr), Rishi Dhawan (55 Lakh), Nathan Coulter-Nile (3.5 Cr), Rovman Powell (30 Lakh), R Sanjay Yadav (10 Lakh), Ishank Jaggi (10 Lakh), Darren Bravo (50 Lakh), Sayan Ghosh (10 Lakh) 
Mumbai Indians: 
Mumbai kept most of its player from the last season and is probably the most stable team right now. They got a good player in Karn Sharma to partner Harbhajan Singh and Krunal Pandya in the spin department while Mitchell Johnson will add experience to the side. It will interesting to see if Krishnappa Gowtham could pull off a Hardik Pandya for them. 
You may also want to watch: 
Existing Players: Rohit Sharma, Kieron Pollard, Lasith Malinga, Harbhajan Singh, Ambati Rayudu, Jasprit Bumrah, Shreyas Gopal, Lendl Simmons, Vinay Kumar, Parthiv Patel, Mitchell McClenaghan, Nitish Rana, Siddhesh Lad, J Suchith, Hardik Pandya, Jos Buttler, Tim Southee, Jithesh Sharma, Krunal Pandya, Deepak Punia. Players Bought: Nicholas Pooran (30 Lakh), Mitchell Johnson (2 Cr), K Gowtham (2 Cr), Karn Sharma (3.2 Cr), Saurabh Tiwary (30 Lakh), A Gunarathna (30 Lakh), K Khejroliya (10 Lakh) 
Rising Pune Supergiants: 
Pune entered the auction with an aggressive approach and ensured they sign the high-profile England all-rounder Ben Stokes along with Dan Christian who could be a bargain buy at Rs.1 Crores. Indian fast bowling was a big concern for the side last year and signing Jaydev Unadkat may solve it. 
Existing Players: MS Dhoni, Ajinkya Rahane, R Ashwin, Steven Smith, Faf du Plessis, Mitchell Marsh, Ashok Dinda, Ankush Bains, Rajat Bhatia, Ankit Sharma, Ishwar Pandey, Adam Zampa, Jaskaran Singh, Baba Aparajith, Deepak Chahar, Usman Khawaja, Mayank Agarwal. Players Bought: Ben Stokes (14.50 Cr), Jaydev Unadkat (30 Lakh), Rahul Chahar (10 Lakh), Saurabh Kumar (10 Lakh), Dan Christian (1 Cr), Milind Tandon (10 Lakh), R Tripathi (10 Lakh), Manoj Tiwary (50 Lakh), Lockie Ferguson (50 Lakh) 
Royal Challengers Bangalore: 
RCB have ticked all the boxes. They had a very string squad already and with the signing of Tymal Mills, they have now replaced Mitchell Starc successfully. Pawan Negi will add balance to the side while Aniket Choudhary can be the surprise package of the season. 
Existing Players: Virat Kohli , KL Rahul, AB de Villiers, Chris Gayle, Yuzvendra Chahal, Harshal Patel, Mandeep Singh, Adam Milne, Sarfaraz Khan, S Aravind, Kedar Jadhav, Shane Watson, Stuart Binny, Samuel Badree, Iqbal Abdulla, Travis Head, Sachin Baby, Avesh Khan, Tabraiz Shamsi Players Bought: Pawan Negi (1 Cr), Tymal Mills (12 Cr), Aniket Choudhary (INR 2 Cr), Praveen Dubey (10 Lakh), Billy Stanlake (30 Lakh) 
Sunrisers Hyderabad: 
Sunrisers Hyderabad had failed to replace Amit Sharma since he left for DD and signed 3 spinners in Rashid Khan, Pavin Tambe and Mohammad Nabi to address that problem. Chris Jordan at just Rs. 50 lakhs is another great buy while the local boy Mohammed Siraj could be their trump card this year. 
Existing Players: Shikhar Dhawan, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, David Warner, Moises Henriques, Naman Ojha, Ricky Bhui, Kane Williamson, Siddarth Kaul, Bipul Sharma, Ashish Nehra, Yuvraj Singh, Ben Cutting, Abhimanyu Mithun, Mustafizur Rahman, Barinder Sran, Deepak Hooda, Vijay Shankar. Players bought: Tanmay Agarwal (10 Lakhs), Mohammad Nabi (30 Lakh), Ekalavya Dwivedi (75 Lakh), Rashid Khan (4 Cr), Pravin Tambe (10 Lakh), Chris Jordan (50 Lakh), Ben Laughlin (30 Lakh), Mohammed Siraj (2.60 Cr) Please Wait while comments are loading...
